wikipedia_page.main:
Hugh Glanffrwd "Jimmy" James AFC & Bar, DFM (3 October 1922 – 7 January 2015) was a Welsh aviator and Royal Air Force (RAF) officer, who rose to the rank of squadron leader. 
His plane, a Bristol Bombay of No. 216 Squadron RAF (a slow transport plane flying a usually "safe" route) was shot down on 7 August 1942 carrying Lieutenant General William Gott to meet Churchill; leading to Bernard Montgomery's promotion.

response: * Jimmy James, the nickname of Hugh James (1922–2015)

John Hugh James MC & Bar (4 May 1890 – 23 April 1967) was an Australian rules footballer who played in the VFL between 1909 and 1916 and, upon returning from military service, from 1919 to 1923 for the Richmond Football Club.
* First World War Nominal Roll: Lieutenant John Hugh James, Australian War Museum.
* First World War Service Record: Lieutenant John Hugh James, National Archives of Australia.
